intro: Pagamea reducta, commonly known as the small pagamea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Pagamea reducta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
